text:
facebook twitter email comments 
Associated Press NYC Daybook for Tuesday, Sep. 06. 
The daybook is for planning purposes only and is not intended for publication or broadcast. You should verify any event you plan to cover. 
Please keep the AP in mind when news develops. 

NEW YORK CITY 
Tuesday, Sep. 06 8:45 AM Annual 9/11 Remembrance Ceremony in Brooklyn Borough Hall - Brooklyn Borough President Eric Adams hosts his annual 9/11 Remembrance Ceremony in the rotunda of Brooklyn Borough Hall, commemorating the 15th anniversary of the September 11th attacks on the World Trade Center. Event includes interfaith prayer, readings and tributes by surviving family members, selections from the Brooklyn Conservatory of Music, and a moment of silence at 9:58 AM EDT followed by the lowering of the American flag atop Brooklyn Borough Hall and the placement of a remembrance wreath outside the building by BP Adams and victims' familie 
Location: Brooklyn Borough Hall, 209 Joralemon St, Brooklyn, NY New York City www.brooklyn-usa.org https://twitter.com/bpericadams 
Contacts: Stefan Ringel Brooklyn Borough President's Office Communications Director sringel@brooklynbp.nyc.gov 1 718 802 3831 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 8:50 AM Piece of World Trade Center steel begins journey to Gander, Canada, in recognition of the role the town played after 9/11 - Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Foundation Chairman and CEO Frank Siller and retired FDNY firefighter Bob Beckwith, plus 50-100 motorcycle escorts, begin an almost-1,500-mile journey to transport a piece of steel beam from the World Trade Center to Gander in Newfoundland, Canada, in recognition of 'the tremendous generosity shown by the town' * Following the 9/11 attacks, planes in flight were ordered to be grounded, resulting in almost 7,000 passengers landing in Gander, which has a population of 10,000. Residents welcomed thousands of strangers into their homes, and fed and cared for them in the following days 
Location: FOX News Network's studios, 1211 Avenue of the Americas, New York, NY New York City tunnel2towers.org https://twitter.com/Tunnel2Towers 
Contacts: Catherine Christman Tunnel to Towers Foundation cath137@aol.com 1 803 240 5863 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 9:15 AM Nasdaq Opening and Closing Bells - Apranga APB Chairman of the Board Darius Mockus rings the Nasdaq Opening Bell (9:15 AM EDT) * CardConnect Corp President and CEO Jeff Shanahan rings the Closing Bell (3:45 PM EDT) 
Location: Nasdaq MarketSite, 4 Times Square, New York, NY New York City http://www.nasdaq.com/ https://twitter.com/NASDAQOMX 
Contacts: Emily Pan NASDAQ OMX press emily.pan@nasdaq.com 1 646 441 5120 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 9:30 AM NYSE Opening and Closing Bells - Hanesbrands Inc. Chief Operating Officer and CEO-elect Gerald Evans and Chairman and CEO Rich Noll ring the New York Stock Exchange Opening Bell, to celebrate the company's 10th anniversary of listing on the NYSE (9:30 AM EDT) * PepsiCo, Inc. Vice Chairman and Chief Scientific Officer Mehmood Khan, Susan G. Komen Greater NYC CEO Linda Tantawi and their guests Carmela Carollo and Phyllis Discioscia ring the Closing Bell, to highlight the annual Komen Greater NYC Race for the Cure, held 10 Sep (4:00 PM EDT) 
Location: NYSE, New York, NY New York City nyse.nyx.com/ https://twitter.com/NYSE 
Contacts: NYSE media relations media@theice.com 1 770 857 4700 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 10:00 AM City of New York Environmental Control Board public hearing 
Location: ECB Conference Room, 66 John St, New York, NY New York City http://www.nyc.gov/html/oath/html/home/home.shtml 
Contacts: Simone Salloum NYC OATH SSalloum@oath.nyc.gov 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 10:00 AM DJ Quacker the Duck calls on Donald Trump to release his tax returns - DJ Quacker the Duck releases his tax returns and calls on 2016 Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump to do the same 
Location: Trump Tower, 725 5th Ave., New York, NY New York City www.americansunitedforchange.org https://twitter.com/AU4Change 
Contacts: Jeremy Funk Americans United For Change funk@americansunitedforchange.org 1 202 470 5878 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 10:30 AM UNICEF hold media briefing on 'Uprooted: The growing crisis for refugee and migrant children' report - UNICEF Deputy Executive Director Justin Forsyth and Policy Specialist Emily Garin hold embargoed press briefing on UNICEF report 'Uprooted: The growing crisis for refugee and migrant children' * Report embargoed until 5:01 AM EDT on 7 Sep 
Location: UNICEF House, 44th St between 1st and 2nd Aves, New York, NY New York City http://www.unicef.org https://twitter.com/UNICEF 
Contacts: Najwa Mekki UNICEF media (Education) nmekki@unicef.org 1 212 326 7162 Christopher Tidey UNICEF press ctidey@unicef.org + 41 22 909 5715 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 10:30 AM NYC Education Chancellor Farina's public schedule - New York City Department of Education Chancellor Carmen Farina appears live on WNYC with Brian Lehrer (10:30 AM EDT) and hosts ribbon cutting for the Dock Street School for STEAM Studies, 19 Dock St, Brooklyn (1:00 PM EDT) 
Location: New York, NY New York City schools.nyc.gov https://twitter.com/NYCSchools 
Contacts: NYC Education Chancellor’s Press Office 1 212 374 5141 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 - Sunday, Sep. 11 11:00 AM US Open quarterfinals begin with Novak Djokovic in action - 136th US Open tennis championships continue with the first quarterfinal singles ties: in the men's draw, World No. 1 and top seed Novak Djokovic of Serbia plays ninth seeded Frenchman Jo-Wilfried Tsonga while 10th seed Gael Monfils and No. 24 seed Lucas Pouille contest an all-French affair, while women's ties are second seed Angelique Kerber of Germany meeting Italy's seventh seed Roberta Vinci and Dane Caroline Wozniacki taking on fellow non-seed Anastasija Sevastova of Latvia. In the men's doubles, third-seeded American brothers Bob and Mike Bryan play eighth-seeded Spanish pair Feliciano and Marc Lopez (who are unrelated) for a place in the semifinals, while at the same stage of the mixed doubles, non-seeds Asia Muhammad and Taylor Townsend face fellow American Bethanie Mattek-Sands and her Czech partner Lucie Safarova (the 12th seeds) and Americans Nicole Gibbs and Dennis Novikov face the German/Croatian pairing Laura Siegemund and Mate Pavic (with neither duo seeded) 
Location: Flushing Meadows Corona Park, New York, NY New York City www.usopen.org https://twitter.com/usopen #usopen 
Contacts: Chris Widmaier USTA widmaier@usta.com 1 914 696 7284 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 11:00 AM NYC officials and advocates file for release of NYPD misconduct record - Press conference to announce filing of amicus briefs by New York City elected officials and community groups in support of New York state court decision ordering release of New York Police Officer Daniel Pantaleo's misconduct record summary, for his involvement in the death of Eric Garner, who died 17 Jul 2014 after being put in a chokehold when he refused to be handcuffed during his arrest on suspicion of selling loose, untaxed cigarettes. Attendees include Eric Garner's mother Gwen Carr; Manhattan Borough President Gale Brewer; New York City Council members Ritchie Torres, Brad Lander, Robert Cornegy, and Andy King; Legal Aid Society Criminal Practice Attorney-in-Chief Tina Luongo; New York Civil Liberties Union Executive Director Donna Lieberman; LatinoJustice PRLDEF Deputy General Counsel and Legal Director Jose Perez; and Communities United for Police Reform 
Location: Steps of City Hall, New York, NY New York City changethenypd.org https://twitter.com/changethenypd 
Contacts: Mandela Jones Communities United for Police Reform mandela@changethenypd.org 1 646 214 1031 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 11:00 AM Dem Rep. Carolyn Maloney and fashion experts release report on 'economic benefits of fashion industry' - Democratic Rep. Carolyn Maloney joins fashion industry professionals to release a report from the Joint Economic Committee Democratic staff on 'the economic benefits of the fashion industry to New York and the U.S.', outlining the industry's impact on jobs, wages, and local business. Attendees include IMG Fashion Senior Vice President and Managing Director Catherine Bennett, Garment District Alliance Vice President Gerald Scupp, MILK co-founder Mazdack Rasi, designer Karolina Zmarlak, and shoe designer Vanessa Noel 
Location: Moynihan Station, 33rd St between 8th and 9th Ave, New York, NY New York City maloney.house.gov https://twitter.com/RepMaloney 
Contacts: Grace Harman Rep. Maloney New York press office Grace.Harman@mail.house.gov 1 212 860 0606 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 11:30 AM New York Mayor de Blasio's public schedule - New York Mayor Bill de Blasio appears live on ABC's 'The View' with First Lady Chirlane McCray (11:30 AM EDT) and joins New York Police Commissioner William Bratton to discuss crime statistics, via press conference, One Police Plaza, New York (1:30 PM EDT) 
Location: New York, NY New York City www.nyc.gov/mayor https://twitter.com/NYCMayorsOffice 
Contacts: New York Mayor’s Office pressoffice@cityhall.nyc.gov 1 212 788 2958 
For the press conference, NYPD credentialed members of the media should be in place no later than 1:00 PM EDT 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 12:00 PM Boxers Sergey Kovalev and Andre Ward give press conference on upcoming fight for 'Pound for Pound' supremacy 
Location: Le Parker Meridien, 119 West 56th St, New York, NY New York City www.mainevents.com https://twitter.com/main_events 
Contacts: Ellen Haley Main Events ehaley@mainevents.com 1 973 903 6715 
12:00 p.m. ET - Media Arrival and Lunch 12:30 p.m. ET - Press Conference Begins 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 12:00 PM NYC Public Advocate James' public schedule - New York City Public Advocate Letitia James delivers remarks at press conference call for Halal and Kosher food in public schools, City Hall Steps, New York (12:00 PM EDT) and at press conference with tenants at 888 Grand Concourse, Bronx (6:30 PM EDT) 
Location: New York, NY New York City http://pubadvocate.nyc.gov/ https://twitter.com/TishJames 
Contacts: Anna Brower Public Advocate for the City of New York press abrower@pubadvocate.nyc.gov 1 917 671 8504 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 12:00 PM Senior Day at the Bronx Zoo - New York City Council Member Fernando Cabrera hosts Senior Day at the Bronx Zoo, with seniors and their family members receiving free admission, free food and a tour of the park and attractions 
Location: Bronx Zoo, Bronx, NY New York City council.nyc.gov https://twitter.com/NYCCouncil 
Contacts: Claire McLeveighn Office of NYC Council Member Fernando Cabrera cmcleveighn@council.nyc.gov 1 347 590 2874 x 209 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 12:30 PM New York State Assemblyman Ron Kim discusses 'importance of equality for women and LGBTQ rights' - New York State Assemblyman Ron Kim holds event to endorse New York State Sen. Toby Ann Stavisky with women's groups, and then discusses the 'importance of equality for women and LGBTQ rights' 
Location: In front of 137-58 Northern Blvd, Flushing, Queens, NY New York City http://stavisky.com/ https://twitter.com/tobystavisky 
Contacts: Joe Reubens Friends of Toby Ann Stavisky 1 212 571 7717 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 1:00 PM New York State Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli releases report on Lower Manhattan's economy - New York State Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli is joined by by elected officials and representatives of the Lower Manhattan business community, to release a report on the neighborhood's economy, highlighting the growth of jobs and businesses in the area 
Location: Lower Manhattan HQ, 150 Broadway, New York, NY New York City http://www.osc.state.ny.us/ 
Contacts: Matt Sweeney Office of NYS Comptroller msweeney@osc.state.ny.us 1 212 383 1388 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 1:00 PM U.N. Security Council development - U.N. Security Council adopt new mandate for the International Criminal Tribunals for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY) 
Location: United Nations Headquarters, New York, NY New York City http://www.un.org/Docs/sc/ https://twitter.com/UN_News_Centre 
Contacts: U.N. press inquiries2@un.org 1 212 963 5851 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 2:00 PM Joy Behar and Candace Cameron Bure light Empire State Building in 'The View' colors - 'The View' co-hosts Joy Behar and Candace Cameron Bure participate in the ceremonial lighting of the Empire State Building in the show's colors of blue, teal and orange to celebrate its 20th season 
Location: Empire State Building, 350 5th Ave, New York, NY New York City http://www.esbnyc.com https://twitter.com/EmpireStateBldg 
Contacts: Rebecca Timms UEG Rebecca.Timms@uegworldwide.com 1 212 738 6068 
Media Check-in: 1:45 PM EDT * Photo Opportunity 2:00 PM EDT 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 3:00 PM 9/11 survivors' art gallery opens at NYC Health and Hospitals/Bellevue - 'Transformations in Time' exhibition opens at NYC Health and Hospitals/Bellevue's World Trade Center Environmental Health Center, showcasing the artwork of 9/11 survivors who are patients at the hospital. The exhibition also commemorates the 15th anniversary of the September 11th attacks on the World Trade Center 
Location: NYC Health and Hospitals/Bellevue, 462 First Ave., New York, NY New York City http://www.nyc.gov/html/hhc/html/home/home.shtml https://twitter.com/NYCHealthSystem 
Contacts: Amy Di Leo NYC Health and Hospitals Media Relations Amy.DiLeo@nychhc.org 1 212 562 4516 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 4:00 PM FDNY adds 17 names to memorial wall for death related to World Trade Center illnesses - New York City Fire Department (FDNY) adds the names of 17 FDNY members who died of related to their work in the rescue and recovery effort at the World Trade Center to the FDNY World Trade Center Memorial Wall. Attendees include FDNY Commissioner Daniel Nigro and First Deputy Commissioner Robert Turner * Including the members added today, the wall lists the names of 127 FDNY members 
Location: FDNY Headquarters, 9 Metrotech Center, New York, NY New York City www.nyc.gov/html/fdny/html/home2.shtml https://twitter.com/FDNY 
Contacts: New York City Fire Department Press Office 1 718 999 2056 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 5:00 PM Dem congressional candidate Espaillat and NYC Public Advocate James express support for State Senate candidate Alcantara - Democratic congressional candidate for New York Adriano Espaillat, New York City Public Advocate Letitia James, and uptown women community and tenant leaders rally in support of Democratic New York 31st District State Senate candidate Marisol Alcantara 
Location: 210 Sherman Ave., New York, NY New York City 
Contacts: Jonathan Davis jonathan.davis@gmail.com 1 917 544 2213 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 6:00 PM Anna Wintour hosts pre-Fashion Week Hillary Clinton fundraiser with Chelsea Clinton in New York - Vogue Editor Anna Wintour and Hillary Clinton aide Huma Abedin host 'Made for History Fashion Show and Rooftop Party with Chelsea' fundraiser with Chelsea Clinton in New York, on behalf of 2016 Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton. Event includes designs and appearances by Joseph Altuzarra, Tory Burch, Georgina Chapman, Dao-Yi Chow & Maxwell Osborne, Eva Fehren, Prabal Gurung, Brett Heyman, Marc Jacobs, Pamela Love, David Neville and Marcus Wainwright, Monique Pean, Tanya Taylor, Thakoon, Diane von Furstenberg and Jason Wu 
Location: Spring Studios, New York, NY New York City www.hillaryclinton.com https://twitter.com/hillaryclinton 
Contacts: Hillary for America press press@hillaryclinton.com 
Closed press 
Tuesday, Sep. 06 7:00 PM Chely Wright begins North American tour 
Location: City Winery, 155 Varick St., New York, NY New York City https://twitter.com/chelywright 
Contacts: Elaine Schock Shock Ink elaine@shockink.com 1 818 932 0001 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 - Sunday, Oct. 09 7:00 PM Neil LaBute's new play begins previews Off-Broadway - 'All the Ways to Say I Love You', previews begin for Neil LaBute's new Off-Broadway solo-play about a high school English teacher who recounts her experiences with a favored student from her past, starring Judith Light and directed by Leigh Silverman. Opening night 28 Sep * A one-night-only benefit reading of LaBute's other new work, 'Reasons to be Pretty Happy', will take place Sunday, led by Paul Rudd 
Location: Lucille Lortel Theatre, 121 Christopher St, New York, NY New York City http://www.mcctheater.org/ https://twitter.com/mcctheater 
Contacts: Michael Jorgensen DKC/O&M Co michael@omdkc.com 1 212 695 7400 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 7:00 PM New York State Sen. Martin Golden honors 10 New York City Police Officers - New York State Sen. Martin Golden honors 10 New York City Police Officers with recognition from the New York State Senate at a special ceremony. Eight of the officers are being honored for their use of Narcan to save lives, and two of the officers are being celebrated for their 'extraordinary' help in welcoming a new baby into the world 
Location: 68th Precinct, 333-65th St, Brooklyn, NY New York City http://www.nysenate.gov/ https://twitter.com/nysenate 
Contacts: John Quaglione Office of State Sen. Marty Golden quaglion@nysenate.gov 1 718 238 6044 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 - Sunday, Oct. 02 7:15 PM Jack Gleeson stars in New York transfer of comedy play 'Bears in Space' - 'Bears in Space', Irish comedy play transfers to New York with original cast members, including 'Game of Thrones' star Jack Gleeson, who features alongside his fellow Collapsing Horse theater company members Aaron Heffernan, Cameron Macaulay and Eoghan Quinn. The show uses makeshift puppets and tells the story of two cosmonaut bears on a spaceship being chased by villainous beings through the vastness of outer space. Production is written by Quinn and directed by Dan Colley 
Location: 59E59 Theaters, 59 E 59th St, New York, NY New York City http://www.59e59.org https://twitter.com/59E59 
Contacts: Karen Greco Karen Greco PR karen@kgrecopr.com 1 212 753 5959 x 121 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 Rihanna Fenty Puma collection goes on sale in NY and LA pop-ups - Rihanna's new Fenty x Puma footwear and apparel collection goes on sale in a series of pop-up stores in New York and Los Angeles. The stores are located within Bergdorf Goodman on 5th Avenue in New York; and the SIX:02 stores on West 34th Street, New York and Melrose Avenue, Los Angeles. The collection launches globally online and in select stores tomorrow. Rihanna is reportedly expected to visit the SIX:02 pop-up in New York 
Location: New York City Los Angeles http://www.puma.com/ https://twitter.com/PUMA 
Contacts: Teril Turner Bergdorf Goodman teril_turner@berdorfgoodman.com 1 646 735 5350 Teresa Tayzon PUMA International Public Relations teresa.tayzon@puma.com 1 617 488 2993 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 - Thursday, Sep. 08 Barclays CEO Energy-Power Conference 
Location: New York, NY New York City http://investmentbank.barclays.com/ 
Contacts: Barclays Investment Bank investmentbankwebsite@barclays.com 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 - Thursday, Sep. 08 Citi Global Technologies Conference 
Location: New York, NY New York City http://citiconferences.com/ https://twitter.com/Citi 
Contacts: Citigroup press 1 212 793 0710 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 - Wednesday, Sep. 07 Deutsche Bank Aircraft Finance and Leasing Conference 
Location: Deutsche Bank, 60 Wall Street, New York, NY New York City http://www.conferences.db.com/ https://twitter.com/Deutsche_News 
Contacts: Catherine Brown DB conferences catherine.brown@db.com 1 212 250 1929 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 - Friday, Sep. 09 Holy See’s U.N. mission hosts conference and exhibition on Mother Teresa’s life and legacy - Permanent Observer Mission of the Holy See to the United Nations, together with ADF International, celebrates the declaration of Mother Teresa as a saint 4 Sep by hosting a conference and exhibition dedicated to her words, witness, and works 
Location: United Nations Headquarters, New York, NY New York City https://holyseemission.org/ https://twitter.com/HolySeeUN 
Contacts: ADF media relations 1 480 444 0020 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 New York Governor Andrew Cuomo is in New York City 
Location: New York City www.governor.ny.gov/ https://twitter.com/NYGovCuomo 
Contacts: New York Governor Press Office press.office@exec.ny.gov 1 518 474 8418 

LONG ISLAND 
Tuesday, Sep. 06 9:00 AM Nassau County Legislator Carrie Solages takes ride to announce new Elmont Flexi Route - Nassau County Legislator Carrie Solages joins local residents, bus activists and members of NICE Bus to celebrate one of the maiden trips of the new Elmont Flexi Route, which begins service today. The Flexi Route replaces the N2/N8 route, following months of fighting for the restoration of bus services to Elmont 
Location: Corner of Dutch Broadway and Fletcher Ave, Elmont, NY www.nassaucountyny.gov 
Contacts: Lauren Corcoran-Doolin Nassau County LCorcoran@nassaucountyny.gov 1 516 571 6280 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 9:00 AM Suffolk County Exec and Police Commissioner swear in new class of police recruits - Suffolk County Executive Steve Bellone and Suffolk County Police Commissioner Timothy Sini swear in the newest class of police recruits who will begin their 29-week training at the Suffolk County Police Academy today 
Location: Police Academy, Brentwood, NY www.co.suffolk.ny.us/police 
Contacts: Suffolk Police Public Information Office 1 631 852 6308 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 11:00 AM NYAGV endorse Dem congressional candidate Anna Throne-Holst - New Yorkers Against Gun Violence endorse Democratic congressional candidate for New York's 1st District Anna Throne-Holst. Event speakers include Suffolk County Legislator Kara Hahn, New Yorkers Against Gun Violence's Leah Gunn Barrett, and gun violence survivor Shenee Johnson 
Location: 3249 Route 112, Medford, NY http://nyagv.org/ https://twitter.com/nyagv1 
Contacts: NYAGV nyagv@nyagv.org 1 212 679 2345 Leah Gunn Barrett New Yorkers Against Gun Violence 1 240 535 5083 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 11:00 AM Suffolk County Police and Crime Stoppers announce new PSA campaign - Suffolk County Police Commissioner Timothy Sini and Suffolk County Crime Stoppers President Nick Amarr announce the Department's new 'Lock It!' campaign, to encourage residents to lock their vehicle doors after parking. The Department is partnering with Crime Stoppers to air public service announcements on the radio and television throughout the county, during Sep 
Location: H. Lee Dennison Bldg, Hauppauge, NY www.co.suffolk.ny.us/police 
Contacts: Suffolk County Public Information Office PIO@suffolkcountyny.gov 1 631 852 6308 

WESTCHESTER & ROCKLAND 
Tuesday, Sep. 06 11:00 AM '9/11: Serve + Remember' volunteer kick off event - '9/11: Serve + Remember' volunteer kick off event, promoting the volunteer opportunities available 9 - 11 Sep. Attendees include Westchester County Executive Robert Astorino, Volunteer New York! Executive Director Alisa Kesten and Robison Oil President David Singer 
Location: Westchester County Center, 198 Central Avenue, White Plains, NY White Plains http://www3.westchestergov.com/ https://twitter.com/westchestergov 
Contacts: Ned McCormack Westchester County Government Communications Director ejm2@westchestergov.com 1 914 995 2932 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 7:00 PM City of New Rochelle Zoning Board public meeting 
Location: City Hall, New Rochelle, NY New Rochelle http://www.newrochelleny.com/ https://twitter.com/NewRochelleNY 
Contacts: Kathy Gilwit City of New Rochelle kgilwit@newrochelleny.com 1 914 654 2117 

Tuesday, Sep. 06 7:30 PM Ossining Town Board Work Session 
Location: 16 Croton Ave, Ossining, NY http://www.townofossining.com/ 
Contacts: Dana Levenberg Town of Ossining Supervisor dlevenberg@townofossining.com 

NEW YORK CITY 
NEW EVENT: Wednesday, Sep. 07 2:10 PM Taran Killam and Bobby Moynihan visit Empire State Building to promote new movie - Actors Taran Killam and Bobby Moynihan promote the upcoming release of their new comedy 'Brother Nature' with a visit to the Empire State Building 
Location: Empire State Building, 350 5th Ave, New York, NY New York City http://www.esbnyc.com https://twitter.com/EmpireStateBldg 
Contacts: Amanda Gorin UEG Amanda.Gorin@uegworldwide.com 1 646 226 3683 
Media Check-in: 1:50 PM EDT 

NEW EVENT: Wednesday, Sep. 07 4:30 PM NY state Sen. Jeff Klein co-hosts 'Jewish Board of Family & Children Services Interview Fair' - New York State Sen. Jeff Klein and Bronx Chamber of Commerce host 'Jewish Board of Family & Children Services Interview Fair' 
Location: Hutchinson Metro Center, 1200 Waters Place, Bronx, NY New York City www.bronxchamber.org 
Contacts: Bronx Chamber of Commerce 1 718 828 3900 

UPDATED EVENT: Wednesday, Sep. 07 11:00 AM Veterans and Gold Star families discuss Donald Trump's 'unfitness to be commander in chief' - Veterans and Gold Star families discuss 2016 Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump's 'unfitness to be commander in chief' via press conference outside Trump Tower, ahead of the IAVA Commander-in-Chief forum tonight * Press conference is organized by VoteVets.org 
Location: in front of Trump Tower, 717 5th Ave, New York, NY New York City www.votevets.org 
Contacts: Eric Shmeltzer VoteVets.org Media eric@votevets.org 1 646 290 8586 

UPDATED EVENT: Wednesday, Sep. 07 11:30 AM The Couture Council Luncheon - The Couture Council of The Museum at the Fashion Institute of Technology (FIT) luncheon, including presentation of the 2016 Couture Council Award for Artistry of Fashion to Akris Creative Director Albert Kriemler. Previous recipients include Manolo Blahnik, Oscar de la Renta, Valentino, Karl Lagerfeld, Dries Van Noten, Isabel Toledo, Alber Elbaz and Ralph Rucci. Guests expected to include Judith Ripka, Martha Stewart, Veronica Webb, Susanne Bartsch, Yaz Hernandez, Michele Gerber Klein, Anne Goldrach and Prince Dimitri of Yugoslavia 
Location: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts, 10 Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY New York City http://fitnyc.edu/ https://twitter.com/museumatFIT 
Contacts: Izzy Tassy Sunshine Sachs tassy@sunshinesachs.com 1 212 691 2800 
Press check-in 10:30 AM EDT * Red carpet begins 11:30 AM EDT * Red carpet ends/luncheon and award ceremony begins 12:00 PM EDT 

UPDATED EVENT: Wednesday, Sep. 07 - Sunday, Oct. 16 7:00 PM Play about Nat Turner launches NYTW's 2016/17 season - 'Nat Turner in Jerusalem', previews begin for Nathan Alan Davis' new play about Nat Turner, the leader of the 1831 slave uprising in Virginia, imagining his final night in a jail cell in Jerusalem, VA, as he is visited by attorney Thomas R. Gray and their discussion of what has passed and what the dawn will bring. Directed by Megan Sandberg-Zakian, the play launches NYTW's 2016/17 season and stars Phillip James Brannon and Rowan Vickers. Opening night 26 Sep * A major movie about Turner's slave revolt directed by Nate Parker, entitled 'The Birth of a Nation', is released in theaters 7 Oct 
Location: New York Theatre Workshop, New York, NY New York City http://www.nytw.org/ https://twitter.com/nytw79 #NatTurnerInJerusalem 
Contacts: Claire Wojciechowski Matt Ross PR claire@mattrosspr.com 1 212 756 1248 

UPDATED EVENT: Wednesday, Sep. 07 8:00 PM IAVA hosts televised Commander-in-Chief forum with Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump - Iraq and Afghanistan Veterans of America (IAVA) hosts 2016 Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton and Republican nominee Donald Trump for a live televised primetime forum, simulcast on NBC and MSNBC and streaming on NBCNews.com, to focus exclusively on issues the next president will have to confront as Commander-in-Chief. Event includes the candidates appearing back-to-back, taking questions on national security, military affairs, and veterans issues from NBC News and an audience comprised mainly of military veterans and active service members 'TODAY' co-anchor Matt Lauer moderates 
Location: Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum, Pier 86, West 46th Street & 12th Ave, New York, NY New York City iava.org https://twitter.com/iava #NBCNewsForum. 
Contacts: Erika Masonhall NBC News Communications erika.masonhall@nbcuni.com 1 212 664 3230 Allison Jaslow IAVA allisonj@iava.org 1 212 982 9699

UPDATED EVENT: Wednesday, Sep. 07 - Sunday, Sep. 11 Serena Williams due to contest US Open quarterfinal - 136th US Open tennis championships continue with the remaining quarterfinal ties, expected to feature a clash in the women's draw between U.S. top seed Serena Williams and Romanian fifth seed Simona Halep. World No. 1 Williams, 34, set a new Grand Slam record of 308 victories with a win over Yaroslava Shvedova in the last round. The victory saw her surpass Roger Federer in the all-time list of matches won at major tournaments. Elsewhere, men's second seed Andy Murray is due on court against Japanese sixth seed Kei Nishikori; Argentinean wild card Juan Martin del Potro is set to play Swiss No. 3 seed Stan Wawrinka; and Ana Konjuh (unseeded) is expected to meet Karolina Pliskova (No. 10 seed) in the other women's tie 
Location: Flushing Meadows Corona Park, New York, NY New York City www.usopen.org https://twitter.com/usopen #usopen 
Contacts: Chris Widmaier USTA widmaier@usta.com 1 914 696 7284

Wednesday, Sep. 07 10:00 AM High-level forum on global anti-Semitism held at U.N. headquarters - U.S. Mission to the United Nations, Permanent Mission of Canada to the United Nations, Permanent Mission of Israel to the United Nations, and European Union Delegation to the United Nations jointly host daylong forum on global anti-Semitism, including high-level remarks plus interactive panels examining the rise of global anti-Semitism from the perspective of governmental, nongovernmental and private sector representatives, and providing recommendations for effective responses addressing the challenge in the future. Holocaust historian Deborah Lipstadt keynotes, with other speakers including U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon and actress Rachel Weisz (via pre-recorded video), U.S. Ambassador to the U.N. Amb. Samantha Power, permanent representatives from the other host missions, and U.N. General Assembly President Mogens Lykketoft 
Location: United Nations Headquarters, New York, NY New York City www.usunnewyork.usmission.gov https://twitter.com/USUN 
Contacts: USUN Press and Public Affairs usunpublicaffairs@state.gov 1 212 415 4050

Thursday, Sep. 08 9:30 AM Vaughn College holds 'Resiliency Roundtable' on traumas endured by aviation employees - Vaughn College holds 'Resiliency Roundtable', commemorating the 15th anniversary of 9/11 with a roundtable discussion on the traumas endured by aviation employees and veterans. Panelists include Debbie Roland, an American Airline (AA) flight attendant and colleague of the crew from AA 77 that crashed into the Pentagon; Toni Knisley, AA's flight services manager in DC; Eileen Ammiano, a United Airline flight attendant trainer for the crew from UAL FL 93 that left Newark and crashed in PA; John Duval, head of Operations at Logan International Airport on 9/11; and four Iraq and Afghanistan veterans from the Edge4Vets program at Fordham 
Location: Vaughn College, 8601 23rd Ave, New York, NY New York City http://www.vaughn.edu/ https://twitter.com/VaughnCollege 
Contacts: Charlotte Tomic Tomic Communications charlotte@tomiccommunications.com 1 917 882 5243

Attendees include Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment Commissioner Julie Menin, NYC Department of Small Business Services Commissioner Gregg Bishop, Writers Guild of America, East Executive Director Lowell Peterson, 'House of Cards' creator and showrunner Beau Williams, 'The Divide' creator and film writer Richard LaGravenese, and 'Law & Order: Special Victims Unit' Co-Executive Producer Julie Martin

Thursday, Sep. 08 10:00 AM Press preview of Charlotte Bronte's manuscripts, letters, and rare books - Press preview of the 'Charlotte Bronte: An Independent Will' exhibition, bringing together literary manuscripts, intimate letters, and rare printed books, before it opens to the public tomorrow. Highlights include Bronte’s earliest surviving miniature manuscript, her portable writing desk and paint box, one of her own dresses, and a pair of her ankle boots. Also on view, for the first time in North America, is a portion of the manuscript of 'Jane Eyre', from the collection of the British Library 
Location: The Morgan Library & Museum, New York, NY New York City http://www.themorgan.org/ https://twitter.com/MorganLibrary
